CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered a socially - owned company , Holding - PERSON AD PERSON ( hereinafter “ the debtor ” ) , to pay the applicant specified amounts on account of compensation for expropriated real estate plus the costs of the civil proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the applicant the enforcement costs .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the restructuring of the applicant ’s debtor . As a consequence , the ongoing enforcement proceedings against the debtor would appear to have been stayed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor . The applicant duly reported her claims based on the above - mentioned judgment to the insolvency administration .
CARDINAL . The insolvency proceedings are still ongoing and the said court judgment remains unenforced to the present day .
CARDINAL . According to publically available information the debtor is still , predominantly comprised of socially - owned capital ( see ORG , accessed on DATE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG . In terms of redress , relying on LAW DATE , the applicant sought , inter alia , compensation for the pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage suffered due to the impugned non - enforcement .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant noted the adoption of the amendments to LAW , and specified her compensation claims accordingly . Specifically , on account of the pecuniary damage , the applicant requested the respective amounts awarded to her by the final judgment in question , whilst as regards the nonpecuniary damage sustained she claimed MONEY ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found , in the operative part of its ruling ( u izreci ) , that the applicant had indeed suffered a violation of her right to a fair trial within a reasonable time , as well as a violation of her property rights and awarded her ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in respect of the non - pecuniary damage in question . However , it rejected the compensation claim regarding the pecuniary damages sought by the applicant . ORG , lastly , ordered the speeding up of the impugned enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . In its reasoning , ORG stated in respect of the compensation issue that the applicant ’s pecuniary damage claim had been lodged out of time . In so doing , it merely referred to LAW , as amended in DATE , requiring that such claims be brought simultaneously with the lodging of a constitutional appeal .
